revised_title: Effects of Marshy Situations on Mortality Rates: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author compares mortality rates in a marshy parish with those in hilly and mountainous areas in Switzerland. The study reveals that people in the marshy parish have significantly lower life expectancy and higher mortality rates, highlighting the insalubrity of such environments. The author suggests establishing similar mortality registers in every part of the kingdom to better understand the impact of different environments on human health.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Environmental Health
